# Surgery
Surgery is used for treating severe and often internal wounds.
## Pain Management
Pain management is an important part of surgery, as excessive pain will cause your patient to go into cardiac arrest.
When powered, operating tables can entirely suppress your patients' ability to feel pain.
Nitrous oxide can also be used for anesthesia.
When none of the above are available, normal painkillers are an option.
## Performing Surgery
In order to conduct surgery, your patient must not have any clothing obstructing them, and must be laying down.
Hospital gowns and tank harnesses can be operated through.
Use surgical tools in the orders described below to perform operations.
## Surgical Steps
The following is a list of surgeries you can perform.
### Opening An Incision
The first step of most surgeries.
### Closing An Incision
The last step of most surgeries. An incision must be open. The rib cage must be closed.
### Bone Repair
Mend fractures in your patient. An incision must be open.
### Artery Repair
Mend damaged arteries in your patient. An incision must be open.
### Open The Rib Cage
For operating on internal organs. An incision must be open.
### Close The Rib Cage
For when you're done operating on internal organs. The rib cage must be open.
### Heart Repair Surgery
For when the patient's heart is damaged. The rib cage must be opened.
